text: Mario Fiorentini (7 November 1918 â€“ 9 August 2022) was an Italian partisan, spy, mathematician, and academic. He was a professor of geometry at the University of Ferrara. He helped an assault mission at Regina Coeli prison and took part in the organization of the attack in via Rasella. He was Italy's most decorated World War II partisan. Fiorentini died on 9 August 2022 at a hospital in Rome, Italy at the age of 103. ==References== Category:1918 births Category:2022 deaths Category:Italian academics Category:Italian centenarians Category:Italian mathematicians Category:Italian military people Category:Military personnel of World War II Category:People from Rome Category:Spies
title: Mario Fiorentini
